text: so far our New Year's plans involve lots of chopping, a little baking, about 3 pounds of meat, and 3 different trips to the grocery store.
@jkottke getting "who is this" IMs from people who added *me* is one of the few things that completely makes me lose my mind.
Is there a way to convert a VMWare Fusion image to a Bootcamp partition?
@shaderlab @jayallen I warned you guys!
d'oh, that's mactactic.com
Thx 2 all; Consensus is to wait for MacWorld to get a Mini. @torrez points out mactactics.com, which is useful but shouldn't be necessary.
@jsmooth995 happy birthday!
A nice night at home -- oh yeah, *this* is what people are talking about when they say "weekend"!
twitterfriends straw poll: who thinks there will be a new Mac Mini in January? A.K.A. Should I get one now?
It's pleasantly quiet without any of the NYU kids in town during the holidays.
loving kalefeh talking about lil' wayne's amazing 2007: http://tinyurl.com/2ykwlh
The Bhutto-as-Archduke Ferdinand meme seems to be spreading prodigiously.
Charlie Wilson's war was pretty good, but I'd expected more songs by the Gap Band.
@kteeger New York!
I am increasingly convinced that copyright assertions are the last refuge for people who are losing an argument.
Out back freezing in the yard with the father in law, fryin' up a turkey. Everyone's dogs are inside wrestling.
Just found out prior to frying the turkey, that this gas canister doesn't talk to this fryer. MacGyverisms and explosions to follow. Xmas!
Lamenting that I didn't get super-trampy Bratz gifts for all my friends' kids.
Pro tip: putting something in your cart on Amazon.com is not the same as ordering it in time for Xmas delivery.
Getting ready for a road trip with the dog, the cat, and the human.
We're now the first people I've ever met who've been inside a Dell store. It's closer to a used car lot than an Apple store.
About to see Juno, the Jamie Lynn Spears biopic.
It's alright, Mary J. Blige is here now and her music is going to take care of everything.
Huh. The Optimus Maximus keyboard at the Wired retail store has an LJ button built in.
A spontaneous foobar has broken out @ Apperceptive world HQ.
Working @ apperceptive in a thinly-veiled attempt to steal their pizza.
Yay! My bit on NPR's Bryant Park Project is live now: http://tinyurl.com/2zqfwx That was fun.
I keep thinking that if Jamie Lynn Spears got an abortion, she would be more relevant to politics and the election than George Bush.
Shortest day of the year -- does that mean less work?
you can listen to Bryant Park Project here: http://tinyurl.com/2lx545
About to be on. NPR's The Bryant Park Project in a few minutes!
bemused that i still have the capacity for self-righteous anger
Enjoying explaining how Hindu deities are like comic book heroes: Lots of bright colors, superpowers and retcons. I'm the Jaganath, bitch!
Finding out if the guy by the neighborhood mosque really has "the best flafel in town", typo notwithstanding..
It's already a more productive day than yesterday.
Oxtail soup on a cold night has charms to soothe the savage beast. Farewell, most frustrating day ever...
@shellen congrats on joining the LJ team!
@lynneluvah AskMen's definition of "women in tech" is "women in media". I don't think the editors know anything about women *or* tech.
@jkottke that's because the submitters act like they're bookmarking, not blogging.
After lunch with Choire, I feel like a real blogger again.
@djacobs what if we stayed at home and played video games online? is that nerdy?
"has requested your trust on spock" sounds like a parody of a Facebook app for Trekkies. That is not praise.
@nyc nerds -- it has become clear we need a real geek event. Am I right? Who's in?
@fimoculous that's hardly NYC's version of nerdiness :)
"Beat It 2008 with Fergie" seems like a pretty good way to piss on the corpse of Michael Jackson's career. (Note: I did not make this up.)
I'm seeing an interesting frontlash of people saying Leopard is a pain in the butt and Vista isn't so bad after all.
@bluejake i updated, but how is the new version significantly better than the last one? better archiving?
The tea shop is jumpin' off this morning with Biz Markie and '03 Bonnie & Clyde replacing the usual twee acoustic ish.
Got around to watching Borat tonight. Pretty good, but the best part was the DVD extras & collecting data on which jokes my wife laughed at.
Here's the score, courtesy of Internet mob rules: Stealing photos, songs -- okay! Stealing web designs -- bad! Misusing "stealing" -- great!
@bluejake get your oven (and stone) as hot as it can be. Be miserly with very good quality toppings. Pizza is well-made bread, not a pie.
@jsmooth995 that was almost word-for-word my wife's assessment. If American Idol were about the process of creating pop? I'd watch that.
After being married for years, I am shocked to discover my wife plays Guitar Hero southpaw.
Uptown in a freezing Central Park getting ready to watch the wife run a race.
Midnight at Grand Central is charming; Scrooge-proof holiday decorations and suburban kids catching the train home before curfew.
I have almost taught my dog to respond to the command "Reconsider your lifestyle."
the issue isn't about knol; the issue is that google lacks theory of mind. see: http://icanhaz.com/gtom
heh, i meant to type 3 years later. old age causes typos.
I'm sentimental, but 4 years later, seeing TypeKey as a sign in on Blogger comments reminds me of the good old days. http://icanhaz.com/tk-b
Any morning is redeemed by a still-warm fresh NY bagel.
Thinking about Knols? Worth revisiting Google's First Mistake, almost 5 years ago: http://tinyurl.com/24v5bo
After dinner with waxy and rex, I feel like a real blogger again.
I'm still 15 years old. I was turning off NWA on iTunes because mother-in-law was calling on the phone and I didn't want to get in trouble.
@spenceke no i grew up in America.
Really excited about chance of snow this weekend.
@goldman have you thought about being young? maybe if you were young you'd get it. pyra's server names made me <3 Zep.
It's been fun announcing the open source version of MT today. If you Digg, I'd be obliged: http://tinyurl.com/yqybqc
i am *way* too tired for it to only be noon. I need a cheerleader!
MS releases software early, and Enderle says it's because it's unpopular? Couldn't it just be good code? http://tinyurl.com/22saw3
there's some web ad campaign with Dave Navarro endorsing Vaseline. Must be the work of the same team that did "Second Life = ghost town."
Still sad about Anita Rowland -- you can remember her and donate in her memory here: http://jackwilliambell.livejournal.com/198715.html
i want to ride on Dick Costolo's Adventure Ship
@racerrick great call! i would have totally forgotten marc, despite loving his blog.
i'm having a lot of fun writing up my Blogs of the Year. http://tinyurl.com/28mjxq Suggestions welcome!
Struggling to get in the zone on the ton of writing I have to do.
There's a Second Life promo for "I Am Legend"? Tip to friends at Linden: The movie is about an *empty city*. I'm just sayin'.
Explaining to my dog that we are going to get her a nose job because "the pug look is in this season". She is unamused.
@check I'm spotting you 50 points for "kwyjibo".
hooray for @torrez and @amberdawn! this is a good weekend for happily ever after.
congrats to @spenceke and @benbrown
@djacobs if that was in our game I'm happy to disqualify it.
Props to the girl proudly doing the Walk of Shame down Avenue B at 4pm.
holy crap, just went to the best, craziest sly & the family stone show in 30 years.
@ezrakilty totally alive. wisih you were here!
I have an extra ticket for Sly & the Family Stone tonight -- IM me @ anildash if interested.
@miz_ginevra the only way to win is to not play
my wife has threatened to start making undesired changes on my facebook profile. beware of spurious fanships!
i just found out Miss America's pet issue is "Internet Safety". I suspect she's not thinking "the hype about predators online is overblown."
@nelson the D- is for "delicious!"
Just walked by the tree at Rockefeller Center and accidentally through 20 tourist's xmas photo shoots.
Listening to Thriller in honor of its 25th anniversary. "Human Nature" and "Lady in My Life" are still the 2 most underrated tracks.
Well, this is a side of 7am that I haven't seen in a while.
Really satisfied that the hardest, best work that I do is the least visible stuff.
So proud of the Serious Eats team on their one year anniversary! http://www.seriouseats.com/
omg hooray meetings!
@fimoculous the danger is not that they fail, but that they succeed.
Finally, finally sleeping. Regrets to everyone I didn't get to see on this trip.
did anybody make a "suggested twitter friends" app that will tell me who I should follow that I'm not?
@bluejake i only accept loonies and toonies.
It's still not too late to be among my first 100,000 fans on Facebook: http://tinyurl.com/yofqpq
A long day, but I'm happy for LiveJournal and happy for Six Apart.
When it rains, it really pours.
Bummed out to have missed the snow in NYC.
Omg it's hindi karaoke at my parents' house and their friends are singing some song that sounds like tom waits.
My mom on counterfeit darjeeling tea brokers: "they should cut off their hands and feet!" She's kidding, but my family takes tea seriously.
Celebrating one full week of Beyonce's "Get Me Bodied" being stuck in my head all the time. Patting my weave to mark the occasion.
It's really kind of embarassing how much I love DVD extras.
What I'd I just do nothing instead of going out on a friday night? Is that a good option, SF people? :)
